article_title: Conroe clinic seeks to fill gap in mental health services
article_text:
Conroe clinic seeks to fill gap in mental health services

Photo: Billy Smith II, Staff Residency Program Director and CEO of Lone Star Family Health...

Agustin Gutierrez has heard the story many times: patients looking for mental health care get turned away from hospitals and doctors because they aren't insured or can't pay the bills.

article_metadata.description: Gutierrez, a licensed counselor focusing on substance abuse and mental health issues, said that even when patients do find a doctor or counselor willing to treat them, they face long wait times, a demoralizing prospect for those suffering from depression.  [...] one of the few local agencies that provide health care to Montgomery County's low-income population is expanding its services as demands for treating anxiety, depression and substance abuse increase along with the county's population.  Julie Martineau, the executive director of Montgomery County United Way, which is working on a study of mental health services and substance abuse in the county, said the Lone Star clinic is already a "go to" spot for many patients who are uninsured or on Medicare or Medicaid.  According to statistics compiled by the Robert Wood Johnson Foundation, a national charity focused on public health, each person in Montgomery County experiences 3.8 mentally unhealthy days per month, compared to 3.3 from the state; 17 percent of the population engages in excessive drinking, compared to 16 percent statewide.  In rural areas the distances between residents and facilities where they can get mental health care is larger than in cities, making it even more difficult for people to get treatment.  Beyond the hiring of more mental health specialists, communities can close the gap in care through tele-medicine programs, where patients talk remotely with counselors or other specialists, school counseling and faith-based programs focusing on mental health.
article_metadata.author.name: By Mihir Zaveri
